abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Telecommunications
            Sector Modernization Project for Indonesia was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicated that
            adequate technical assistance to build good project
            management and implementation capacity at Telkom, greatly
            contributed to the success and sustainability of the
            project. Building a strong constituency for reform is
            important to minimize resistance to change. Continuity in
            the supervision team is critical for a satisfactory project implementation.
